discipline.ja: ものづくり技術（機械・電気電子・化学工学）

paper_title.en: Two dimensional AC magnetic properties of non-oriented electrical steel sheet under two-dimentional DC-biased magnetization

description.en: Electrical steel sheet have been widely employed as a magnetic core material of electromagnetic equipments. Magnetic materials in the equipments may be excited under two-dimensional AC-magnetization and/or AC-magnetization with DC-biased magnetization. However, the magnetic properties of electrical steel sheets under two-dimensional DC-biased magnetization have been scarcely researched. In this paper, we have inquired the magnetic properties of electrical steel sheet under a simple two-dimensional AC-magnetization with highly DC-biased magnetization of a direction perpendicular to AC-magnetization. We have found that the phase difference of between the fundamental components of B and H under high DC-biased condition becomes very smaller and phase compensation is very important in loss measurement. Also, we found that the magnetic loss under two-dimensional AC-magnetization is very sensitive to magnetic flux density waveform.

publisher.en: Institute of Electrical Engineers of Japan

publication_name.en: IEEJ Transactions on Fundamentals and Materials

paper_title.ja: Low-temperature synthesis method of aluminum nitride powder
paper_title.en: Low-temperature synthesis method of aluminum nitride powder

description.ja: Copyright © 2015 by the American Ceramic Society. All rights reserved. Direct nitridation using Al-Mg alloy have been tried at a lower reaction temperature than conventional methods without reaction additives or diluents. Low crystallized A1N powder appeared at 620 degree Celsius and impurities such as Mg3N2, MgO existed. After calcination at 1700 degree Celsius for 2 hours, A1N was crystallized and Mg3N2 disappeared. Alternatively, Al10N8O3 appeared. Purity of the A1N powder should be calculated and improved.
description.en: Copyright © 2015 by the American Ceramic Society. All rights reserved. Direct nitridation using Al-Mg alloy have been tried at a lower reaction temperature than conventional methods without reaction additives or diluents. Low crystallized A1N powder appeared at 620 degree Celsius and impurities such as Mg3N2, MgO existed. After calcination at 1700 degree Celsius for 2 hours, A1N was crystallized and Mg3N2 disappeared. Alternatively, Al10N8O3 appeared. Purity of the A1N powder should be calculated and improved.

paper_title.en: Effects of compressive stress normal to the surface of grain-oriented electrical steel sheets

description.en: The magnetic properties of grain-oriented electrical sheets were measured under compressive stress applied in the thickness direction using a single-sheet tester with two H-coils. This apparatus can apply uniform stress throughout the specimens. Decreases in both the permeability and magnetic losses are observed in the specimens under normal stress of 20 MPa. This normal stress can reduce both hysteresis and the eddy-current losses.

publication_name.en: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF APPLIED ELECTROMAGNETICS AND MECHANICS

paper_title.en: Magnetic Property of Iron-Dust Cores With Mixture of Ferromagnetic Ferrite Powder and Alumina Powder

description.en: Iron-dust cores are produced from insulated iron particles by using the powder metallurgy pressure forming process. These dust cores are suitable for small motor cores because of their high shape flexibility; however, the iron loss of iron-dust cores is larger than conventional laminated cores. Generally, the insulation material between the iron particles degrades the magnetic property of the core. In this paper, the magnetic property of the iron-dust core in which the resin, which is usually used as insulation material, is replaced by the soft magnetic Mn-Zn ferrite or alumina is examined. We have found that the iron-dust core mixed with alumina particles shows higher space factor, 10% lower iron loss, and 30% higher permeability. Contrary to expectation, the magnetic properties of the iron-dust core deteriorate by mixing with soft magnetic Mn-Zn ferrite.

paper_title.en: Effects of compressive stress normal to the surface of non-oriented electrical steel sheets

description.en: Changes in permeability and magnetic losses in non-oriented electrical steel sheets resulting from compressive stress have been investigated using a single-sheet tester. A compressive stress of up to 20 MPa is uniformly applied normal to the sheet surface. It is demonstrated that a stress beyond 5 MPa can decrease magnetic losses, including both hysteresis loss and eddy current loss.

publication_name.en: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF APPLIED ELECTROMAGNETICS AND MECHANICS

paper_title.en: High bonding strength between stainless steel and aluminum alloy using resistance spot welding

paper_title.en: Examination of measurement apparatus for 2D magnetic properties

description.en: The development of highly efficient electrical rotating machines is an important issue in energy conservation. To realize this goal, we must consider the details of magnetic phenomena in rotating machines. Therefore, an accurate evaluation of 2D magnetic properties is indispensable. However, it is very difficult to measure these properties, especially under high magnetic induction, due to the difficulty in measuring rotating magnetic properties in electrical steel sheets. In this paper, a new apparatus with an eight-tooth-core, distributed windings, and interpoles, is proposed in order to measure 2D magnetic properties. We evaluate the uniformity of magnetic conditions in specimens by finite element analysis. © 2013 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.

paper_title.en: AC Magnetic Properties of Electrical Steel Sheet Under Two-Dimensional DC-Biased Magnetization

description.en: AC magnetic properties of electrical steel sheets are generally evaluated under symmetrical alternating magnetization in the standard magnetic measurement. However, magnetizing conditions of electrical steel sheets in electromagnetic machines are not always symmetric and alternating magnetization. This paper presents a new measuring system for AC magnetic properties of electrical steel sheets under two-dimensional DC-biased magnetization and discusses the properties under DC-biased magnetization.

paper_title.ja: AC magnetic properties of electrical steel sheet under DC-biased magnetization | Właściwości magnetyczne AC blach elektrotechnicznych podmagnesowanych polem DC

However, magnetizing conditions of electrical steel sheets in electromagnetic equipments are not always symmetric and alternating magnetization. This paper presents a measuring system for AC magnetic properties of electrical steel sheets under two-dimensional DCbiased magnetization and discusses the properties under DC-biased magnetization.

However, magnetizing conditions of electrical steel sheets in electromagnetic equipments are not always symmetric and alternating magnetization. This paper presents a measuring system for AC magnetic properties of electrical steel sheets under two-dimensional DCbiased magnetization and discusses the properties under DC-biased magnetization.

paper_title.ja: Magnetic properties of non-oriented electrical steels under compressive stress normal to their surface | Właściwości magnetyczne blach elektrotechnicznych niezorientowantych poddanych napre{ogonek}żeniu ściskaja{ogonek}cemu normalnemu do powierzchni
paper_title.en: Magnetic properties of non-oriented electrical steels under compressive stress normal to their surface | Właściwości magnetyczne blach elektrotechnicznych niezorientowantych poddanych napre{ogonek}żeniu ściskaja{ogonek}cemu normalnemu do powierzchni

description.ja: Magnetic properties of non-oriented electrical steels are measured under a compressive stress up to 28 MPa normal to their surface. It is shown that the perpendicular stress changes their permeability and magnetic losses along their circumferential direction. The variations in magnetic properties are discussed in terms of changes in magnetic domains due to the stress.
description.en: Magnetic properties of non-oriented electrical steels are measured under a compressive stress up to 28 MPa normal to their surface. It is shown that the perpendicular stress changes their permeability and magnetic losses along their circumferential direction. The variations in magnetic properties are discussed in terms of changes in magnetic domains due to the stress.

paper_title.en: Examination of measurement apparatus for 2-D magnetic properties

description.en: Development of high efficient electrical rotating machines is an important issue in energy conservation. To realize this purpose, we have to consider details of magnetic phenomena in rotating machines. Therefore an accurate evaluation of the 2-D magnetic properties is indispensable. However, it is very difficult to measure these properties especially under high magnetic induction due to difficulty to measure rotating magnetic properties in the electrical steel sheets. In this paper, a new apparatus with 8-teeth-core, distributed windings, and inter-poles is proposed to measure the 2-D magnetic properties. We evaluate the uniformity of magnetic conditions in the specimen by using the finite element analysis. © 2011 The Institute of Electrical Engineers of Japan.

publication_name.en: IEEJ Transactions on Fundamentals and Materials

paper_title.en: Magnetic measurements of electrical steel sheet by using digital sampling method

description.en: Today, digital sampling method has been widely used for magnetic measurement. In this paper, the results of the round robin test (RRT) on magnetic properties of electrical steel done at five laboratories in Japan by using digital sampling method have been discussed.

paper_title.en: Magnetic shielding by grain-oriented electrical steel sheet under alternating fields up to 100kHz

description.en: Magnetic shielding effectiveness of grain oriented electrical steel was studied at 0.01-100 kHz magnetic fields. The frequency dependent effectiveness was clarified as to material anisotropy of < 100 > and < 110 > in circumferential direction of cylindrical shields. The effectiveness showed the difference over 50kHz between the shields of < 100 > and < 110 > before and after stree-relief annnealing. 3D FEM analysis suggested eddy current distribution affects the shielding effectiveness at higher frequency.

publisher.en: WYDAWNICTWO SIGMA-N O T SP Z O O

paper_title.en: Influence of relaxation phenomena in dynamic magnetization processes on magnetic power losses of non-oriented electrical steel sheets

description.en: We have reported that the magnetic power losses per magnetizing cycle change with the magnetization pausing time in a constant rate of magnetization change and some relaxation phenomena exist in the magnetization pausing period. We discuss the influence of the relaxation phenomena on the dynamic magnetic power losses and suggest that the relaxation phenomena seems to be causes of the frequency dependence of the magnetic losses and of the variation of losses that cannot be expressed only by magnetization speed dependence of losses. (c) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.en: Columnar co-ferrite films with high coercivity on glass and silica substrate by sol-gel method

description.en: Magnetic properties related to nano-structure have been investigated for sol-gel grown Co-ferrite thin films on the substrates of glass and Sio(2)(100). The magnetic properties depended on the annealing temperature and the coercivity of 7.7 kOe was obtained at 923 K on the Sio(2)(100) substrate. The microstructure transformed into columnar from granular at the annealing temperature of 923 K.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF OPTOELECTRONICS AND ADVANCED MATERIALS

paper_title.en: High-frequency magnetic properties of ferrite particulate films

description.en: Ni-Zn ferrite particulate films fabricated by two room-temperature colloidal processing methods are characterized through high-frequency magnetization measurements. The particles for the colloidal solution are synthesized by coprecipitatation, affording particles 5-20nm in size. The films prepared from the solution are shown to consist of 15-40 nm particles in a densely packed arrangement. The film prepared by electrophoretic deposition (EPD) is 12 mu m thick with a comparatively smooth surface. Measurements of the frequency dependence of complex permeability for the films reveal an external bias field dependence and high magnetic resonance frequency (1 GHz), despite the films being isotropic. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.en: Magnetic properties of nanocrystalline ferrite TixCo1+xFe2-2xO4 and CoFe2O4 composite thin films

description.en: TixCo1+xFe2-2x (0 <= x <= 0.5) ferrite films and its composite films with CoFe2O4 synthesized by a sol-gel method were investigated on crystallographic and magnetic properties. Magnetization decreased with the increase of Ti content while coercive force showed a maximum at x=0.2 and comparatively high at x=0.5. Composite films of Ti0.5Co1.5FeO4 and CoFe2O4 showed larger H-c and smaller grains. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: 2D magnetic rotational loss of electrical steel at high magnetic flux density

description.en: Rotational magnetic loss in magnetic core materials has been examined on the direction of rotation at high magnetic flux density. Rotational losses differ remarkably over 1.5T in accordance to the decrease of phase difference between magnetic field H and magnetic flux density B. The rotational losses in clockwise or anticlockwise directions depend largely on inclination angle of magnetic filed sensing axis to orthogonal magnetic flux axes. A reasonable correction of the rotational losses is proposed by measured losses in practical measurements.
